Description: Rim fragment of Milesian pottery plate; micaceous clay, slip on both inside and outside. Rim glazed, band on floor near the edge; frieze of alternating sets of verticals and complex rosettes. Single band preserved on underside. Drilled for sampling
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Compare Heidelberg Antikenmuseum I20, possibly from same plate, though very differently fired.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.902)
